text: Nadiya Jamir Hussain (née Begum; born 25 December 1984) is a British baker, columnist, author and television presenter. She rose to fame in 2015 on the sixth series of the BBC show The Great British Bake Off in which she went on to win. In April 2016, she baked a cake for Queen Elizabeth II’s 90th birthday. She would then go on to present a variety of cookery shows for the BBC. ==Bibliography== ===Cookery=== * Nadiya's Kitchen (Michael Joseph, June 2016) * Nadiya's Bake Me a Story (Hodder Children's Books, September 2016) ===Fiction=== * The Secret Lives of the Amir Sisters (Harlequin, January 2017) ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:English children's writers Category:BBC 100 Women
title: Nadiya Hussain
